abstract.p: Maxine W Davis letter holds Jonathan Allen's March 25 travel article on India failed to mention realities of jet lag

block.p: To the Editor: Jonathan Allen's ''India Made Easy'' (March 25) forgot one vital detail about traveling from America to the opposite side of the world. No matter how well planned your travels, when you return home it typically takes days to make the physical transition to your home time zone.

The common rule is: one day for every one hour difference in time. Some people flying to India make the transition to that time zone with greater ease than others. However, rarely have I seen it the other way around. No matter the sleep aids, drugs, or homeopathic remedies are -- on a return it takes days to get back to everyday life. Realities of our body's time clock should not be forgotten in planning and enjoying a trip.
